description:
If I am using nova-rootwrap, I get the following traceback:

chuck@kenny:~/work/server/openstack/packaging/bzr/nova/build-area$ sudo -u nova /usr/bin/nova-rootwrap iptables-save -t filter
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/nova-rootwrap", line 62, in <module>
    filters = wrapper.load_filters()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rootwrap/wrapper.py", line 34, in load_filters
    __import__(modulename)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rootwrap/compute.py", line 49, in <module>
    Commandfilter("/usr/bin/guestmount", "root"),
NameError: name 'Commandfilter' is not defined
title: nova-rootwrap causes Tracebook

comments.content:
If I am using nova-rootwrap, I get the following traceback:

    filters = wrapper.load_filters()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rootwrap/wrapper.py", line 34, in load_filters
    __import__(modulename)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/rootwrap/compute.py", line 49, in <module>
    Commandfilter("/usr/bin/guestmount", "root"),
NameError: name 'Commandfilter' is not defined
